i also wanted my fins to stand out not flop done the flk fish lips kiss heel the shadow wrap is the same - with this technique you can even add stuffing to the fins and tail if as the tsk and tsp doing the shadow wrap also gets your you d like working yarn onto the correct needle to work back in the other - i wanted the decreases closer to the tail so that there wasn t direction suddenly a decrease in the body in my sea of lovely stockinette again many excellent videos and explanations online there are supplies a couple of small mini-tutorials at the end - worsted weight yarn i like something wash & dry - circular needle in size #7 - length 16 for the body of the fish - circular needle in size #7 - length 32 for body decreases tail & fins rescue row - sharp smaller gauge dpns to help pick up stitches for the fins i used a couple of size #4 dpns to help me but really any small also sometimes called a lifeline if you re worried about a mistake gauge needles will work - i recommend a rescue row now and then to add to your peace of 8 stitch markers one should be distinctive for bor - mind what you basically do is run a slender piece of yarn or thread tapestry needle for weaving in ends - i use a bright nylon thread because i can see it and it s slippery scissors - several short pieces of scrap yarn to tie onto the piece as reminders and easy to pull out later through the stitches this way if i have to as you work along pull out my work later because of a mistake i ll have these correct stitches saved on that thread and the stitches will be easy to put back on my knitting needles if you are new to short row i joining definitely recommend one in the pattern where i ve indicated it if you don t know how to join in the round there are many very good on the tail make sure to go outside of any stitch markers when online resources my preferred method is to cast on one extra stitch the project is done just pull the rescue row thread out there is and pass it over just make sure your work isn t twisted plenty of great information online hat #43 fish
